revised_title: Bleeding of Sycamore Trees and Other Experiments
tldr: The author, Mr. Wray, conducts experiments on the bleeding of sycamore trees and other trees, discovering that only the sycamore and mulberry tree bleed when wounded. He also notes that the bleeding occurs when the weather conditions are right, such as during frost and wind. Additionally, he mentions a relevant note from Pliny about the bleeding of mulberry trees.
